page.title: 06Water Supply.
page.content: Part of the water supply for Leven is located near the north of Letham Glen.This tank holds 300,000 gallons of water.If the Regional supply has to be shut off for maintenance work or an emergency this tank can nearly supply the area for a day if the water is rationed.The service reservoirs are usually reinforced concrete tanks covered with soil and grass to match the surroundings. 600,000 gallons a day is used to supply the whole area. The average household uses 150 gallons a day.A small amount is for drinking and cooking.A lot is for washing and the W.C. The main water supply comes from Glendevon in an 45 cm water pipe.it branches off about 1 kilometre north of Dyke Neuk water tank. The water is distributed to Leven by
